page.title: 06TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A TRAFFIC SURVEY CARRIED OUT AT VARIOUS POINTS AND TIMES DURING THE DAY (10 JULY 85) REVEALED SOME INTERESTING INFORMATION.THE GREATEST VOLUME THROUGHOUT THE DAY WAS THAT OF PRIVATE CARS.THE NUMBER WERE PATICULALY HEAVY BETWEEN 9a.m. AND10a.m. THIS IS SUPRISING SINCE IN A SEPARATE SURVEY OF EMPLOYMENT A HIGH % OF PEOPLE TRAVLE 5 MILES OR MORE TO WORK BY CAR.WHAT WAS SLIGHTLY SURPRISING WAS THE HIGH NUMBER OF HEAVY VEHICLES USING ROADS IN WHAT IS ESSENTIALLY A RURAL AREA.THERE IS NO DOUBT THAT MOST OF THE ROADS ARE INADEQUATE FOR SOME OF THE JUGGERNAUTE USING THEM.THIS WAS CONFIRMED BY SEVERAL INHABITANTS WHO FELT THAT HEAVY TRAFFIC THROUGH THE VILLAGES OF BUMBLES GREEN AND EPPING GREEN WAS EXTREMLEY DANGEROUS
